attributes.action: intervene in the sham MCA consultation process currently underway which aims to remove the Coastguard Rescue Boats  stationed at Hope Cove, Devon and at Torpoint, Cornwall; the MCA is not an honest broker in this consultation process and we believe that both Coastguard Rescue Boats should be retained.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Hope Cove Coastguard Rescue Boat has been the subject of considerable press coverage after launching to the assistance of a 13year old girl in danger of drowning despite instructions from the MCA that their operational role was “suspended” and the boat “withdrawn for survey”.

The Tamar Coastguard Rescue Boat serves Plymouth Sound and South East. Cornwall. In the twelve months prior to being “suspended pending survey” the boat:
 
• attended 12 events afloat specifically for Accident Prevention
• was paged & launched specifically for Search & Rescue work on 11 occasions. On 16 occasions the boat was diverted by Brixham Coastguard Ops Room from Training to Rescue work
• fulfilled a unique shallow water role in Plymouth Sound and the Tamar, which includes open sea, river estuary and  15 square miles of tidal mudflats.
